content.en: Surgical simulation advancements: Researchers are exploring ways to improve the realism of surgery simulators and model the collision response of soft tissues in laparoscopic simulations. They are also investigating how multi-resolution organ models can enhance real-time simulation of organ deformation and how endoscopic image cutting can be simulated using computational geometry. Additionally, they are developing graphic and haptic simulation systems for laparoscopic surgery and studying techniques for efficient simulation of nonlinear tissue materials. These studies involve the use of algorithms from various publishers and institutions.
content.da: Fremskridt inden for kirurgisk simulation: Forskere undersøger måder at forbedre realismen af kirurgisimulatorer og modellere kollisionsresponsen af blødt væv i laparoskopiske simulationer. De undersøger også, hvordan multiresolutionsmodeller af organer kan forbedre realtidssimulering af organsdeformation, og hvordan endoskopisk billedskæring kan simuleres ved hjælp af beregningsgeometri. Derudover udvikler de grafiske og haptiske simulationssystemer til laparoskopisk kirurgi og studerer teknikker til effektiv simulation af ikke-lineære vævsmaterialer. Disse undersøgelser involverer brug af algoritmer fra forskellige udgivere og institutioner.
